tool.name: Discrover
tool.command: discrover #silent contrasts = [] #silent theseeds = "" #for $i, $c in enumerate( $options.contrast ) #silent contrast = "contrast%i" % i #silent contrasts.append(contrast) #if $options.options_select == "simple": motif:$contrast:$c.simple_signal #if $c.simple_control.choice == "file": control:$contrast:"$c.simple_control.file" #end if #else #for $j, $s in enumerate( $c.set ) #if s["is_control"] then "control" else "motif"#:$contrast:$s.file #end for #end if #end for -m motif:${length}x${nseeds} --score motif:${"+".join(contrasts)}:${options.score} -o ${txt_outfile.files_path} #if $strandedness == "dna": -r #end if #if $random_salt_choice.options_select == "specify" --salt $random_salt_choice.random_salt #end if --multiple --compress none > ${txt_outfile} 2> ${time_outfile} && cp ${txt_outfile.files_path}*.accepted.hmm ${hmm_outfile} && cp ${txt_outfile.files_path}*.accepted.summary ${summary_outfile} && cp ${txt_outfile.files_path}*.accepted.table ${table_outfile} && cp ${txt_outfile.files_path}*.accepted.viterbi ${viterbi_outfile}

validator.message: Comma-separated list of one or more length ranges, e.g. '8' or '5,8-9'

param.name: nseeds
param.label: Number of seeds
param.help: For each length, the best N seeds will be found and a HMM will be trained for each.

param.name: is_control
param.label: Treat as control sequences
param.help: Sequences selected as control are not used for learning of context parameters (background emissions and motif priors).

param.name: random_salt
param.label: Salt for random number generation
param.help: You can use this for reproducible random number generation. This influences e.g. the generation of sequence shuffles (which can be used as control).

tool.help:
**Discrover**
https://github.com/maaskola/discrover
*What it does*
The input to Discrover is one or more sets of nucleic acid sequences. The program uses various discriminative objective functions to determine significance of each motif found in the postive set as compared with its representation in the negative set.
.. class:: infomark
**To cite Discrover:** Jonas Maaskola and Nikolaus Rajewsky. *Binding site discovery from nucleic acid sequences by discriminative learning of hidden Markov models*. Nucleic Acid Research, 42(21):12995-13011, Dec 2014. doi:10.1093/nar/gku1083
*Objective functions*
* MICO: Mutual information of condition and motif occurrence * MMIE: Maximum mutual information estimation * MCC: Matthews' correlation coefficient (only binary contrasts) * DLOGL: Difference of log likelihood (only binary contrasts) * DFREQ: Difference of occurrence frequency (only binary contrasts) * Baum-Welch: Likelihood maximization (non-discriminative objective function)
